intro: Marica anceps, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant is adapted to grow in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It produces small, round, yellowish fruits that contain several seeds. Marica anceps is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
